parse: Verb - Present Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To remind, admonish, be reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember, recall. From ana and mimnesko; to remind; to recollect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Formerly, before. Neuter of proteros as adverb; previously.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

word: that you were in the light,
parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From phos; to shed rays, i.e. To shine or to brighten up.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
A struggling (as in an athletic contest). From athleo; a struggle.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.
